contentrichtext.text: {{italic title}}{{Taxobox | name = ''Xylena exsoleta'' | image = Xylena exsoleta.jpg | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Arthropod]]a | classis = [[Insect]]a | ordo = [[Lepidoptera]] | familia = [[Noctuidae]] | genus = ''[[Xylena]]'' | species = '''''X. exsoleta''''' | binomial = ''Xylena exsoleta'' | binomial_authority = ([[Carl Linnaeus|Linnaeus]], [[10th edition of Systema Naturae|1758]]) }} The '''Sword-grass''' ''(Xylena exsoleta)'' is a species of [[moth]] of the family [[Noctuidae]]. It is found from the [[Canary Islands]] and north-western [[Africa]] through [[Europe]], the [[Near East]] and central [[Asia]] up to the Pacific and [[Japan]]. [[Image:Xylena exsoleta.01.jpg|thumb|left|200px]] [[Image:Britishentomologyvolume5Plate256.jpg|thumb|left|200px|Illustration from John Curtis's British Entomology Volume 5]] The [[wingspan]] is 58–68 mm. The length of the forewings is 24–29 mm. The moth flies from September to July depending on the location. The larvae feed on various deciduous trees, shrubs and herbaceous plants, including ''[[Lilium]]'', ''[[Iris (plant)|Iris]]'', ''[[Rumex]]'', ''[[Euphorbia]]'', ''[[Ononis]]'', ''[[Allium cepa]]'', ''[[Brassica oleracea]]'' and ''[[Delphinium]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.nhm.ac.uk/research-curation/research/projects/hostplants/ |title= Robinson, G. S., P. R. Ackery, I. J. Kitching, G. W. Beccaloni & L. M. Hernández, 2010. HOSTS - A Database of the World's Lepidopteran Hostplants. Natural History Museum, London.}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.lepiforum.de/cgi-bin/lepiwiki.pl?Xylena_Exsoleta Lepiforum] *[http://www.vlindernet.nl/?soortcode=XYLEEXSO Vlindernet {{nl}}] *[http://webh01.ua.ac.be/vve/Checklists/Lepidoptera/Noctuidae/Npronuba.htm Lepidoptera of Belgium] *[http://ukmoths.org.uk/show.php?id=1370 Sword-grass at UKmoths] {{commons|Xylena exsoleta}} [[Category:Cuculliinae]] [[Category:Animals described in 1758]] {{Cuculliinae-stub}}
